article:
All about Britain's Teenagers 
School
British teenagers can leave school _ the age of sixteen after taking their GCSE exams. The exams are not easy to pass, _ they have to work very hard! British teenagers often spend 2.5 to 3 hours every evening doing their homework.
Free Time
It's not all work, of course. What do British teenagers do to have _ ? They love watching TV, going out, _ friends and listening to music.
Communications  
Teenagers in Britain often use their computers to play games and do their homework. They _ love their mobile phones, and spend hours texting   their friends and chatting. Today, many mobile phones are very small and light. You can do a lot more _ them than just talk. More than 90% of British teenagers have a mobile phone, and experts  say this stops _ from spending their money on sweets and cigarettes .
Fashion  
At school, almost all British teenagers have to wear 
 _ they can wear whatever they like. In fact, 40% of British teens say that they think it is important to have the latest fashion.
